Reviews.Title: “Poor hotel . . . Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Gage777
Reviews.Content: Let me start off by saying that I always make the best of the situation. However, my wits were tested when I arrived at Altavilla in Rome. The room my wife and I booked looked more like a broom cupboard than a double room. The bed was a three quarter bed, which they tried to pass off as a double. The bathroom looked like something out of a prison movie. The breakfast was very basic and if you arrive late, you will have to make do with whats left. Now, the staff was one of the most friendly and hardworking any hotel could wish for. When we complained about our room the front desk and the porter were scrambling around to find us an alternate room. The staff were always happy , cheerful and willing to help us with any service especially Vito and his very well behaved dog. The poor guy that running the breakfast room in the morning was a shinning example of hard work. Never in my life had I seen a guy mutli-task with such speed and determination between washing dishes, making coffee, laying out the food, clearing the tables and tending to the patrons . . . this was all done by a single person for our 4 day stay for the entire breakfast room which consisted of more than 10 tables. The staff knows the hotel is not the greatest but they tried their best to make our stay comfortable. Sadly, if you have a bad hotel up front, it puts your mood for the stay down.

Reviews.Title: “Ok on a budget”
Reviews.Author: cristinablendea
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Altavilla in 2005 together with some friends during high-school and for a group on a budget it was perfect. The rooms did need a serious makeover and the bathroom fan would go off loudly and randomly, but I remember enjoying a good breakfast and having no trouble sleeping. So for a budget alternative at a good location, very close to Stazione Termini, I can recommend this hotel. However, if you're very picky about cleanliness and room size, you might want to go someplace else.

Reviews.Title: “Our experience here was good.”
Reviews.Author: Anita1970
Reviews.Content: Having initially read some good reviews of this hotel when I booked it several months before our stay, I was alarmed to read, just before our departure, of some peoples' bad experiences. However, I must say that our experience was more than adequate. The rooms are admittedly a little tired and need updating and the toilet did double as a bidet, the hot water was a little sporadic and was a little snug, but for a budget hotel, we could not fault the cleanliness, the breakfast offered nor the staff. We were there for 4 nights and everyday we had fresh towels and our sheets were changed after a couple of nights. Breakfast consisted of cornflakes, orange juice, bread rolls or croissants with jams and tea and coffee, all of it, as much as you wanted. The staff were very helpful and when we had to check out a few hours before we were due to return, they were able to store our luggage for us until we had to go. In short, if you are expecting plush, spacious rooms with all the mod cons then don't stay here, but if you are looking for a hotel within easy reach of the station and public transport and a short walk to many of Rome's main attractions then this is a great place to stay. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Never again this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Charles M
Reviews.Content: I have booked the hotel after i read some of the good reviews on trip advisor. But now i wonder whether these people ever went abroad or maybe it was the staff and their friends who wrote the reviews. I was travelling with my family and we had a triple room which was akready small for two peaple let alone three. But since we only stay in room to sleep it was not that big a problem. The problem was the walls were all damp and in great need of some paint., and furniture need to be changed like one viewer wrote krea have some good cheap furniture. But the biggest problem was the bathroom, Again walls need to be changed, the toilet had a double use one as a toilet and also as a bidet something unheard of. Also when we got in the room we noticed that the toilet was leaking. (this was on a Sunday) I went down to reception to report the problem the reception told us that they will take care of it, and by the gods of Rome they did they put a towel at the back of the toilet. Next morning we woke up to find a complimentary swimming pool and beautiful aromatic smell in the bathroom. Again i informed reception and was told that on sunday they have no plumer (no pluming problems on sunday maybe) and was told that it was already noted and the plumer will see to it straight away. We went out for the day got back late in the evening and beleive it or not the problem was solved yes qiute right by putting another towel at the front. Another thing is the lack of communication after I made the booking on line and got the reservation confirmation number I sent an email asking for some information regarding getting to the hotel and to reconfirm the booking I never got an answer. I don't know how the ministry for tourism in Italy classifies the hotels but sure this hotel should not even deserve to be classified to accomodate people and to think that tourists are made to pay tax to visit the city!!! nice welcome. The only positive about this trip was the historic sites and the visit to the Vatican City.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: rollosmithwrites
Reviews.Content: First thing; once again, forget the wingers. This is a city centre hotel, five minutes walk from the main railway station, shuttle buses to the airports, and the metro, and walking distance to the Colosseo in about twenty minutes. My wife and I stayed there for four nights for 240 euros [plus taxes] That is the price per night for most of the other hotels in this area! This is Rome, not some tiny place in the back of beyond. The negative reviews here are highly untrustworthy because; 1 breakfast is excellent- if you know what a continental breakfast is- fruit juice, croissants, fresh coffee 2 rooms are scrupulously clean 3 bathrooms are basic, but clean Yes aircon is extra; if you want it in with the room rate, go somewhere else, and pay 120 euros per night. When I am in Rome, I, like most normal people spend all available time exploring; the trick is not to spend time in the room. Staff are very friendly, beds are clean and comfortable, towels are fresh and thick; room are not massive, but that is why this is a good value hotel. There is wifi and there are fridges in the rooms, and safe deposit boxes. There are twenty excellent restaurants within five minutes walk.

Reviews.Title: “Exellent location, nice staff and very basic property”
Reviews.Author: Anna388
Reviews.Content: We arrived Rome rather late, 10 PM and it was so pleasant just to step in the hotel right away from Termini station. In spite of the reviews reporting about Termini area like a worrisome one we didn't see neither shady persons nor any kind of trouble. The hotel is very basic, but we had everything we needed, even small frige. The bathroom had no lock - this was probably the only serious flaw. All the rest was equivalent to ours needs - shower, clean beds, coffee in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “I will recomand to my friends”
Reviews.Author: mihaela b
Reviews.Content: I spent a week in Rome with my family, (2 adults& one- 20 years- boy ) staying at Hotel Altavilla .I had reservation through booking.com.Good location ,few minutes frrom Termini Station ,metro and bus station. Stuff was polite and gave us good informations ,Room was cleaned every day.Breakfast was good , based on patisery ,fresh croisssants ,milk , coffea (same at 2 stars hoteL Best deal for the price of the room ,70 euro /night.

Reviews.Title: “Good location at a reduced price”
Reviews.Author: nickroro
Reviews.Content: it has two stars and I booked on booking.com, essential reason being price 70 Euro / night for a triple room with breakfast included, children under 8 years free of charge if sleeping with an existing bed. Added to longer Rome tourist fee of 2 Euro / night / person, children under 10 years do not pay. For 4 nights I gave 304 euros, a family of 2 adults and 2 children 7 to 14 years. The hotel was clean, austere room with basic necessities (TV, clean bathroom, though small, television, refrigerator, safe, ceiling fan, hairdryer. Air conditioning is paid, but additional 15 euro, but I said that if low-cost to low-cost then be:) and we were pleased with the huge fan blades hanging from the ceiling! Breakfast was common for 2-star hotels in Rome: rolls, butter, nutella, bread, milk, coffee, tea, juice from the dispenser, cereal, etc.. It was clean rooms were nice day and Receptionist. Termini area is not too good reputation for safety, but from this point of view, I had no problem, although we returned to the hotel at late hours. I was informed about the hotel on Trip Advisor so I had high expectations, was even better than expected. If you are not very demanding Altavilla is a good choice. Pros: price, central location, friendliness of staff, fast access to means of transport (metro Termini buses Cinquecento Square). Cons: air conditioning cost, if you view street noise (and had to sit with the window open because of heat).

Reviews.Title: “At least it was somewhere to sleep...”
Reviews.Author: JulietB82
Reviews.Content: There's no denying that this hotel is in a really good location - only a couple of minutes walk from the train station, and many of the city's attractions and historic sites are also well within walking distance. There was also always a member of staff at reception to offer directions or advice when needed. The downside was the slightly run-down and extremely basic nature of the place. In fairness, we only paid around 30 euros a night so perhaps it was unfair to expect too much - however, it is worth being aware that if you are wanting to spend any amount of time luxuriating in your hotel room while on holiday then this is definitely not the place for you! Bedroom was pretty small with only very basic amenities, hairdrier and TV being about it. Bathroom was tiny and showers were certainly entertaining, involving sitting in the half-length bath and holding the shower head over yourself. A rather creaky lift and garden furniture in the breakfast room complete the deal. For us, it was literally somewhere to use as a base and to crash in at the end of the day - I suppose you do get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, doesn't deserve the bad reviews!”
Reviews.Author: kats4884
Reviews.Content: I was so worried about staying in this hotel after reading the reviews, but it is really not that bad. At the end of the day you have to remember that it is only 2* and you get what you pay for. I was plesantly suprised! The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. The room was really nice, the bathroom a little dated, but fine. Nice clean bed sheets and towels. Little fridge in the bedroom which was a bonus. Great location near the main train station, and were able to walked to all the attractions! I would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Fawlty towers, the nightmare continues”
Reviews.Author: swiss_gooner
Reviews.Content: After having been ripped off by a Roman taxi driver, we got to the hotel. The guy who checked us in was friendly enough, although his tone revealed that a trove of disaster was waiting to be found. After checking in we were told that the lift was 'on strike' and that we had to take the service lift, which is out the back of the hotel, through a courtyard and into another hotel. The service lift was about 100 years old and the size of one very small Italian. It is old, slow, smells really bad and not recommended for the claustrophobic. The brochure and online brochure mention that the rooms had been 'recently renovated'. I had some news for the owner of this dank establishment, 50 years is not recent. The floors are prison gray and the furniture is ancient. I know we were in Rome to see relics, bt not in the hotel room. OK, it's only a 2 star hotel, but go to IKEA for furnishing, that would be perfectly acceptable. The problem with the room, other than the wardrobe that I was afraid to open for fear of finding the corpse of William Burroughs or an entrance to the catacombs, was that it was being used as general storage for the rest of the hotel. There were no less than 4 beds in a double room, a random dining chair and some kind of sofa bed that was draped in a carpet. The bed was desperately uncomfortable and unromantic as there was a wooden ridge running down the middle of it. The toilet and shower did not have doors. Instead there were wooden folding doors that do not close. The shower door was broken and constantly fell off it's hinges, the basin stand had cigarette burns on it. There was also complimentary mould everywhere. The shower was nothing short of disgusting and we actually resisted sing it for as long as possible. The whole place smells like wet sock and there is a generator in the courtyard that goes off early in the morning. Our window looked out into this soot covered courtyard. We attempted breakfast once, never again. For a nation that at least understand coffee, this hotel ought to be ashamed of itself. The coffee made me gag. The only thing that smelled worse than the hotel was the coffee. The crockery is not washed by machine, instead there is a sweaty little man furiously washing and replacing cups and saucers as people leave and enter. The breakfast hall smells like a scullery that has not seen soap, ever. A steam bath funerary where crockery goes to die. Thankfully though, there is a myriad coffee shops ready to serve you properly. You might have read that this hotel is at least cheap, well I don't think that nearly €100 a night is cheap. If I had known what I was getting myself into I would have opted to roam the streets at night. There is internet usage available, but this will cost you €5 for 3 hours. Go to the nearest internet cafe where you can pick up bandwidth for less than half of that. There is no wifi, not even in the lobby. Do not stay at this hotel. Look around for something else, there must have been at least 5 better looking options on the same block. The only time I spent the night somewhere worse was in a prison cell, fact.

Reviews.Title: “1950,s throwback”
Reviews.Author: Lesleyk81
Reviews.Content: Firstly the hotel is in a good location 5 mins walk from Termini station,walking distance to main attractions such as Piazza Venezia and Trevi fountain took us about 25 mins to there. This hotel is really really old and needs ALOT of work done to it, our room was tiny and really dark and our view was of a really dark courtyard with smelly sheets hanging out and a noisy generator at the window. The furniture was old but it wasn't that bad and the bed linen was simple and clean. The bathroom was not fit for human habitation it was so small even a midget would struggle the shower was really dangerous no grip on the floor and when you stepped out to dry yourself you were basically in the toilet the only plus in the bathroom was the clean towels everyday. the room was manky in that it needs painting and dusting the floor needed cleaning and the curtains were manky aswell. NOT A ROMANTIC PLACE AT ALL. the staff were ok but there was one member of staff he was Italian and had grey hair "the silver fox" very nice and helpful. breakfast i wouldn't bother going down to get it, I would recommended the Ciao restaurant in Termini or the coffee shops in the area, the restaurant across the road was good food was cheap and very nice. The lift in this hotel is a joke i am a slim girl and even i didn't venture into it, im surprised health and safety officers allow it. the hotel is split with another hotel also which was weird! every morning we were woken around 7am by noises of the bins being emptied with bottles from the shops next door and at night noisy people coming in the courtyard. we stayed in this hotel for 3 days it wasn't even that cheap,the trip was good thankfully it made up for the crap room and hotel. Oh and air con is €10 a day and €10 deposit for the crappy telly remotes. Ripp off. Alta villa you are the weakest link...............................Goodbye!

Reviews.Title: “Ok for the budget traveller, but better deals can be found”
Reviews.Author: thewaterboy
Reviews.Content: Budget travel was the essence of this extended summer trip, and Rome did come as a welcome change in that the size of the room was larger than what we expected to be the norm in large European touristic cities. That said, there was nothing else worth mentioning other than the fact that the hotel was very close to Termini - Rome's main station, for those travellers who need to catch an early morn / late evening train / coach to other destinations / Rome's airports. What I didn't like about the hotel is that whilst the room had air con, the control unit was at the reception, and one had to pay an additional 10% on the room rate in order to use it. Our room windows faced the open courtyard which was shared with another hotel and the night we chose to leave the windows open for some fresh air, we were woken early morning with the sounds of bin covers clanging, and bins being dragged across the cobbled courtyard area!!! We had planned to move about & stay in other hotels across the city, and suffice to say that we stayed in better hotels (cheaper and with free air con) ,all of which were conveniently located either close to one of Rome's attractions, with lots of little trattorias around as well as close to a metro stop. Overall, you can surely do better than stay at this place.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you paid for”
Reviews.Author: balu114
Reviews.Content: Just the day before we went to Rome I checked some of the reviews on Tripadvisor and I was quite worried. But it turned out, the hotel is not as bad as I thought. The room and the bathroom were okayish, bit dusty and we had to clean the wooden surfaces on the bedside tables. The business tactic of this hotel is "Have a good website but don't bother with the actual hotel". The hotel has no stairs, only a lift. When it's busy, one may have to wait for 15 minutes to get ground floor from 4th floor. The staircase is behind an emergency door. We didnt wanna open in the fear of triggering a fire alarm. A lady, who waiting with us for the lift to take us to the ground floor, suddenly had a breathing difficulty but can't go out to get some air. Luckily the lift came just in time and she managed to get down (don't know what happened to her as we came down in the next ride after 10 minutes!). Standard breakfast. Nothing to shout about. The good thing about the hotel is it is quite close to the Roma Termini railway station. There are buses to every part of the city from outside the station. Lots of decent restaurants, coffee shops, internet points and a laundrette! The price is reasonable for Rome/Italian price norms. If you are able bodied, looking for a city-break and need a hotel just for spending your nights then this hotel is for you. Anything else, shop elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic memory in rome”
Reviews.Author: duraipandianm
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with my family and it is fantastic pleasure time we spent in rome staying in this hotel. The hotel staff we very cordial and helpful and the hotel is very near to central station termini and the location of hotel is very easily accessable to all the historic monuments and meusiums. The hotel was very clean and we really enjoyed the break-fast servedin the morning which is buffet system with lot of items to choose and my children really enjoyed it.It is the best place to stay in rome for its catagory and price and i recommend this hotel to all my friends to stay here when they come to rome.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for - if you want more, pay more!”
Reviews.Author: Realistic_am_I
Reviews.Content: I read the other reviews on this site just after getting back from the travel agent having booked a twin room in this hotel. I was horrified but was unable to change my very short notice booking without incurring major charges. When we arrived at the hotel, the gentleman on reception was very welcoming and polite (as were all the staff we dealt with during our stay). Our room was an extremely pleasant surprise after the reviews we'd read - it was very clean, the bathroom was small but immaculate, and it was exactly what we had paid for. The room was cleaned every day, and we had none of the complaints that other guests had. The location of the hotel is excellent for the price and we were able to choose whether to use public transport or simply walk to pretty much all of the sites. All in all, we got what we paid for. If we want more next time, we'll pay more, but we would be more than happy to go back and stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “DON'T STAY IN THIS HOTEL. IT'S AWFUL!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ann062
Reviews.Content: This hotel was awful, the pictures on the website are nothing like what we got!! We did expect it to be basic with it being a 2 star, but this was a joke. The bathroom was horrible, I don't know how old the shower curtain was, it was disgusting, we also had some unwelcome guests in the bathroom (ants) Filthy hotel. We're just so glad Rome was amazing and made up for it. The only good thing about it was the location which was great, but, there are far better hotels in he same vicininty. We're hoping to go back later in the year and one thing for sure we won't be staying here.

Reviews.Title: “YUK! Horrible Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Trippa-Holic
Reviews.Content: Well this Hotel was such a disappointment! Do not be fooled by the nice hotel pictures, because it is nothing like that. The Room was filthy and dusty and the Bathroom was just Vomit! We went during the HOT Summer, and needed to Shower like every hour or so, but I had to really restrain myself from showering because the Shower was just disgusting! Out of the 6 Days, we stayed there, the Room was only cleaned once! Plus no air con, and this a major if you are travelling peak summer time! The Single Beds are TINY and close together! The Hotel lift is shared by the Hotel next door and is really tiny, so when we had to take our luggage up, we had to take 2/3 trips up and down the lift to get all our stuff to our Rooms. The Breakfast was nothing special, but okay I guess, considering the price you're paying! Although the Location was good, I'm not too sure about the Local people, because my brother nearly got mugged. He went just outside the Hotel and some guy came up to him and asked him if he was alone, although he was, he just pointed to some guy and said, No, my friends just there, then the Man just left and watched him from a distant; he came up to my brother again asking where his friend was and for the time, and my brother just legged it inside the Hotel. I only booked this Hotel, because the Pictures looked decent and the price was good! I had a fantastic time in Rome but at the end of each day, my mood went down when I came to this Hotel. But I must say, the Reception Staff were very nice and helpful and it is cheap, with good location. Other than that, it's a no no!

Reviews.Title: “Plenty of cardio respiratory exercise!!”
Reviews.Author: Deborahmary
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a short trip to Rome, staying at the Altavilla hotel. Myself and two friends, 3 ladies in 50-60 age range arrived in anticipation of a cultural, educational and enlightening visit. The Altavilla was in a superb position for sightseeing, near to the Termini. The staff on reception were friendly enough, but the lift was out of order and our room was on the fourth floor. There was a very small service lift available, which could accomodate 2 people at a squeeze, but my friends didn't fancy their chances in it and so we walked up the four flights Sunday, Monday,and Tuesday, twice each day. We had to pass through the courtyard on the way to the stairs. Two or three floors above a line of washing was strung across it (see photo). The stairway was dusty and dark and appeared as if it hadn't seen a duster, mop or a fresh coat of paint since Caeser was a boy. The room was adequate, sheets and towels were clean. the shower was tiny with part of the shower cubicle broken (seePhoto). The window and the blind were filthy .We had to put a 5euro deposit on a broken remote control for Tv. We enquired if we could get coffee and were directed to a cafe outside contary to brochure stating 24hour snack-bar. Breakfast was cornflakes, a choice of a roll,a cake tea or coffee. Adequate, but no fruit juice and the girl preparing it was unfriendly. The chairs in the breakfast room were plastic garden chairs. The Altavilla is certainly not a for anyone who is not fully fit. It is probably suited for young singles, definitely not for families or for anyone arranging a romantic weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Hell Hotel”
Reviews.Author: galrua
Reviews.Content: Alora....if you are looking for a nice place to stay in Rome try under a bridge before you book this dank, dirty, smelly, overpriced,bottom feeder of a "hotel". Couldn't stomach even 2 hours in the room, no exaggeration. If you have already booked then, honey, get your money back asap. There are a million better hotels in lovely rome than this.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Location - Great Rates”
Reviews.Author: Linksy
Reviews.Content: I don't understand from the previous reviews if perhaps there are some old rooms that haven't been renovated, but I found none of the problems listed below. It is a city centre 2 star hotel next to Termini so don't expect marble bathrooms or champagne in your room, but you get a good deal for what you pay for here. The accommodation was clean and bright and the rates on offer were excellent. We ended up staying for two nights more that the initial arrival date becuse every other hotel seemed more expensive and all you need a room for in Rome is sleeping and showering. Can't complain at the budget accommodation on offer, and save your money to spend on the myriad of things to do, eat or buy in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT stay here !!”
Reviews.Author: gbazzer
Reviews.Content: Dreadful hotel - nothing like photos on their website. Stayed here for 1 night and it was 1 too many. Room dirty, smelly, noisy. Shower didn't work. Bed was old and uncomfortable. DO NOT stay here. I am not that fussy, honest, but this place is awful.

Reviews.Title: “worse hotel ever, dont stay here”
Reviews.Author: darngar
Reviews.Content: Dont stay here, worse place ever!!! Rooms so small, lights went out and we flew out of the window! View was of a concrete quadrant of the other hotel rooms. Bathroom was the smallest I have ever seen and be warned the hotel website pictures must have been taken from another hotel as there were 6 of us in three seprate rooms and none of them resembled the pictures from the hotel website!!! Dont bother with breakfast unless you want a jam roll and a cup of tea or coffee. Worse hotel ever!!!

Reviews.Title: “Just for sleeping”
Reviews.Author: vloams
Reviews.Content: Indeed, the real hotel cannot be compared with the pictures on its website... We stayed for 2 nights in a big but smelly room on the fourth floor, street side. The traffic was noisy, but reasonable. In our opinion the staff was not rude, but also not very friendly. They understood and spoke English better than we do Italian. The bed was comfortable. But the shower-toilet combination was disgusting. The second day when i flushed the toilet, i had to run to avoid wet and dirty feet... Imagine that you have to step in this mess to get a shower. Fortunatly this happend when we were checking out. We also skipped the 2nd breakfast. The coffee was non-Italian. Do go grab a croissant or something in a bar. Excellent is the location near by the termini station and many places on walking distance. So, just for sleeping this was fine, although 140 euros a night is still expensive for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Altavista must mean room not like picture in Italian.”
Reviews.Author: Al01268
Reviews.Content: This hotel has pictures of the rooms on its website however i'm not sure what hotel these pictures are taken from as out room was nothing like the photos. 3 nights stay in December, the room was just about ok but not to the 2/3 * i would have expected and its not at a value that i would expect for the cost either. The heating does not work or last i could not get it to work. the bath no sorry shower and wc room was the smallest i have ever seen in my lift with a strange toilet to top it all. As we spent very little time in the room just to sleep and shower/change we put up with the size. There was no where to really store you items of clothing etc for two people. One good point the safe in the room was free ( just a deposit) Breakfast the most basic of basic but hay with the vast Italian of foods outside a small breakfast is good as it leaves room for Pizza at lunch ane pasta at dinner. Woudl i stay at this hotel again, well not unless it was the only place i could get into. its only good point really was the location to the train station. 1star *

Reviews.Title: “Very Small Room Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Geocaddy1
Reviews.Content: I was suprised by how the small the room was (two people could not walk side by side in the room). The staff was pleasant, but i did request a wake up call and never received it. It is a decent location from the train station. I booked this hotel at the last minute on the last night of my stay in Rome, it was 60 euro, which i believe for the size of the room was not worth it. I could stay there again, but i would not book my stay there.

Reviews.Title: “When in Rome.....”
Reviews.Author: davegreaves
Reviews.Content: By 2 star Italian standards this is ok. The rooms we had were smaller and darker and shabbier than the ones on the website, but they would have been a bargain. The pictures were probably of their best rooms when newly refurbished and professionally lit! Altavilla is quite near Terminale railway station but is in a street with lots of other hotels and restaurants so it's well lit and populated. Sure you watch your bags but we had no hassle. Reception was fine the staff spoke varying amounts of English, but all spoke better English than I do Italian. Breakfast was Italian style (dry rolls and canteen coffee) with corn flakes also available. Our double was clean if shabby and had a concertina door to the very small bathroom. The shower was hand-held in the bath with no curtain. If you are very obese you might struggle to sit on the loo! My 76 year old mum's single had the loo in the shower so there was a step over the 4 inch wall to get to it. The place was quiet at night and the beds comfortable. There's so much to see and do you won't want to hang out at the hotel. Get up and go!!!

Reviews.Title: “Deceiving: A Shabby Dorm Room for the Price of a Suite”
Reviews.Author: MataKari
Reviews.Content: Our room looked nothing like the pictures on the website: it was tiny, taller than it was wide, with barely enough room to fit a double bed and desk. The walls were painted a tacky powder blue, nothing like the light, airy room we were expecting from their pictures, and the television was bolted high up in the corner like in a bar or bus terminal. Instead of a door, our tiny bathroom was separated from the rest of the room by a wood-paneled sliding curtain that offered little privacy, and our room overlooked a dark, dirty courtyard, where people shouted all night and watched soccer at full volume. My boyfriend and I had booked four nights at the Altavilla long in advance before our trip based on the charming pictures shown on their website. We wanted to treat ourselves to somewhere special to cap off our first vacation together, but were deeply disappointed by what we ended up with. We could not get our money refunded because we had booked so far in advance, and to make matters worse, we passed by a number of rooms that were much nicer than ours as the maid tidied them up in the morning, which cost the same price as our dark little hole (as confirmed by the front desk). When we asked to be moved into one of these rooms, the front desk person cheerily agreed, and said if we packed our suitcases, our luggage would be moved over to the new room by the end of the day. By the end of the day, nothing had changed, and we were told that they booked all other rooms for the night. The front desk person promised that if we kept our suitcases packed, they would move everything after a room had been prepared the next day, but of course it didn't happen then, either. If I had known what to expect, and booked the room on the cheap, this would have worked fine as a budget room. But we were paying top dollar for what seemed more like a hostel room, and felt cheated and lied to by their website and staff. Do yourself a favor and skip it.

Reviews.Title: “some good, some bad”
Reviews.Author: MMJP
Reviews.Content: Myself and 3 friends stayed here for three nights for approx £80 each for all three nights, so quite cheap to book through the web site in advance. Good Points - Decent location, pleasant breakfast, very quiet and some staff friendly and helpful. Bad Points - My room was a little dirty and dingy. The shower leaked more water onto the tiles outside than the trickle which actually landed onto the person showering. Our friends room and shower next door, however, was fine. They charged 10 euros per room per night for aircon which is quite steep I thought. We spent very little time in the hotel and I would recommend this to anybody on a budget and not planning to be in the hotel that much during their visit. Also a good tip - ask for bigger towels, the staff were quite happy to provide them, if there is nothing much bigger than a face cloth in the room when you arrive.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away !!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: basho_razor
Reviews.Content: Ladies and Gentlemen, Stay away from this hotel. We stayed here and the entire setup seems to be out of The Godfather movie ! Rude staff, strange rooms ( either too big or too small ). We were 4 adults and one child. My parents room was so small with a a small toilet and mine was too big with broken lights and a toilet whose door could not be locked. It seems Giada and Altavilla have merged so we were in Giada I think. The reception person was pretty rude, when i wanted to pay by credit card he said the machine was broken, being a techy myself I told him how to run a manual charge by punching in my card number, he said he was not confident and asked me to go get cash. This place is not worth it honestly, avoid , avoid , avoid !!!

Reviews.Title: “Very cheap, but very basic”
Reviews.Author: stavneg
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed in the Alta Villa for 8 nights and found it adequate for our needs. We are well used to budget travelling and only booked a hotel because the hostels in Rome were the almost the same price and it was impossible to get a private room even months in advance. We booked on the web, but when we arrived the place looked different to the photos - it turns out the pictures on the website are of the Hotel Giada, which takes up three of the five floors of the same building - same lift, same breakfast, different entrance, but different business and very different rooms. On the plus side the location near the train station was good (just far enough away from the sleaze and only a ten minute stroll to the Colloseum), the hotel and rooms secure, the bed was comfortable, there were no bad smells, the room was well cleaned every day, and hot water was plentiful at all times. On the minus side the air conditioning was useless, we thought some of the staff were a little rude at times (although after a few days we suspected this was a rather general attitude in Rome and not particular to our hotel), there was quite a bit of noise from around 8 in the morning onwards, as the walls and doors were thin and there was some (much needed) renovation work going on during the week, and the decor and furniture could use some updating. A previous reviewers experience of coming home late to find the door locked and the porter asleep on the couch matched ours, but he woke up and let us in immediately, so it didn't matter. Anyway our room was on the first floor at the rear of the hotel. It had a small double bed, a small bath/shower room, a TV, desk, wardrode etc. The window, like many Roman hotels, looked into a shady internal courtyard, but had a louvred shutter bolted to the outside so there was no view and no light. Fresh towels, soap, shower gel, toilet paper, and clean plastic cups were supplied every day, but there were no fancy extras like sewing kits, shower caps, shoe shines etc. One thing that bothered us was the lack of a 'Do-not-disturb' sign as we like a lie-in and were woken several times each morning by the cleaning lady checking if the room was empty. The Alta Villa was much cheaper than most other hotels at 125 euro per night, so we weren't expecting much, but we still a bit disappointed when we realised we'd been tricked byt he website. However we were there for a wedding and had a chance to compare with the hotels of several friends, and given the price differences the Alta Villa was okay. If you're going away for a short treat then splash out and book a superior room somewhere like the Ariston down the street, double the price, but has all the nice touches. On the other hand if like us you're on a tight budget this is a reasonable option - in Rome you'll be out at the sights all day anyway, so the room is only for showering, sleeping and storing your stuff.

Reviews.Title: “Actually, quite nice”
Reviews.Author: ParentsOf3
Reviews.Content: I am stunned by previous posts ripping this hotel to shreds. Our family of 5 (mom, dad, 3 girls [13, 11 & 9]) stayed for three nights 03Apr06 - 06Apr06 and found the staff to be extremely friendly and helpful. The hotel was located very conveniently near Termini station, and we easily walked to the Colloseum, Forum and Trevi Fountain several times. Being near Termini, we also took advantage of the subway and bus lines (and returned our rental car to the Hertz location in the station). The room itself was fairly large (by European standards), and we paid 120 euros/night. The breakfast was pretty good (the capuccino was excellent!) and our bathroom was new and modern. My one complaint would be the lack of stairs - elevator only access to the rooms. This hotel literally "shares" a building with a hotel next door (Alta Villa got floors 2 and 5, the place next door got floors 3, 4 and 6 - a liitle weird, but whatever). They have separate lobbies and staff (and different room rates), and share the elevator and breakfast accomodations. We had a fine time. I thought the rate was quite reasonable for our size group, the staff were great, and the room was exactly what you'd expect for the price. I'd recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT stay here...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in March 2006 for four days and it was the worst hotel we have ever come across. We have travelled both inside and outside Australia and I have to say this place is worse than a cheap sleazy room in King Cross. We checked in to the hotel when we got there and were told that we have to wait. That was ok and reasonable , however what was not ok is with the staff who were rude and room that was aweful. * Staff - Which staff, it seems that they only have two staff and they were absolutely rude. It may be understanable if they don't understand English but they speak good English and simply choose to be rude. We were absolutely shocked with how we were treated. We got in the room and found that we didn't have a towel. I had to ring them and it took them close to an hour to bring one up with no apology whatsoever. My partner rang to get a glass to brush his teeth but was told that he(the staff) is finishing and could not care less if the room does not have the glass/cup, so we didn't get the glass. * Room and Toilet - I have never come across a room so small with two single bed cramped in there. It was horrible, dark, aweful smell and cold with window that does not have a view. The heater was not working and the toilet is the size of a TV box. No joking. The water does not have any strenght and it just drizzle despite how you turn the tap. The worst thing is.. the HOT water only last 8 seconds.. (Average time), sometime it lasts a bit longer of 10 , but others, it's 6 etc. The toilet is full of mould and smells.. * Lift and Stairs - The lift is very old and dodgy. I was planning to take the stairs but was told that there is no stairs. They only have emergency stairs fitted with alarm to go outside the building. Try having to wait for a lift on level 4 and the lift could only take 6 people at a time !! * Hotel, check in and check out - despite what the website says.. this place is nothing like it. The hotel is not well maintained. As for check out, The hotel sign says that we could check out anytime, 24 hours. On the day we needed to check out 4:30 am, we found a guy snoring on the sofa at the reception area. we tried to wake him out, but he would not get up. I had to press the emergency alarm to wake him up, otherwise, we would have missed our flight. I would NEVER EVER stay in this place again and WOULD STRONGLY recommend others to avoid it.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was really disappointing, compared to the web site I'd seen which encouraged me to book!! Despite being told on the website the room was 'renovated', mine certainly wasn't. Dark & gloomy & small, pokey bathroom. For the same price I'm sure that one can find better!!

Reviews.Title: “A mixed bag”
Reviews.Author: PerthTripper
Reviews.Content: The Alta Villa is handy to Rome's main station (Termini), and walking distance to the coliseum and forum. The staff were friendly, and there are a number of good cafes and restaurants in the immediate vicinity. Against that, the room was tiny, and rather dingy. The bathroom was even smaller - the toilet was actually in the shower. No airconditioning, and a lot of noise (sounded like somebody watching the soccer on TV) late at night. OK if you're on a tight budget, but I'm sure there are much better places in Rome for not much more money.

Reviews.Title: “A very poor hotel -certainly not worth it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I very strongly recommend against this hotel. It is extremely tired and shabby - holes in the walls, bare electrical wires, nasty stained carpets, etc etc. It is certainly not worth the 125 euros we paid. Fortunately we had not pre-paid for our trip and only stayed one night before moving elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay at the AltaVilla”
Reviews.Author: George_Laker
Reviews.Content: If this is not the dirtiest, darkest, most uneffecient hotel in Rome, then I would be very surprised. The web site bears no relation to the hotel whatsoever. Even if you get this hotel for 20 Euros a night you are being ripped off.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid!!!”
Reviews.Author: love2travelIreland
Reviews.Content: This hotels Website is very deceiving as I learned on a recent stay in Hotel Altavilla Rome. All aspects of this hotel needs major work from Room standards, decor and cleanliness and most especially Customer Service!!! Not very welcoming, helpful or friendly - the fundementals you would expect from any supposed *** 3 Star Hotel - This hotel charges 3 Star rates but in reality I have stayed in much better hostels in my years or travelling - I would not recommend this hotel or return here.

Reviews.Title: “Poor, Poor, Poor. Service terrible”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We are not fussy. However the web site of this hotel puts a very different reflection on reality. Eventually after haggling we got a somewhat decent room for our 119 per night. The customer in this 'hotel' certainly does not come first. Abrupt and unhelpful. Everything is a hassle. We have travelled alot and this rates as the worst hotel experience. In fact I have stayed in better hostels. We returned to Rome at our trip end and stayed in a great place - half the price.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: alexspider
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend stayed in this hotel for three nights. It was a pleasant surprise. You get all what you pay for. The room was very clean and the bathroom was new. Our room was on the back of the building (room 136) so it was very quiet. Also the staff was wery friendly. Hotel is near Termini train station and the location is very safe (you can read all sorts of things). We recomende it!

HotelInfo.Name: Altavilla
